page.title: 08STOURBRIDGE SWIMMING BATHS
page.content: The public{baths}in Stourbridge were opened in 1900.It is rather unusual because there are two pools.The indoor pool measures twenty five yards.The outdoor pool measures thirty three and one third yards and it has a diving board and{sunbathing}area.It is open during Summer months only.The indoor pool is open every day of the week and it costs sixty five pence for adults and thirty five pence for children.The baths were built on top of an underground well and the water from the well is used to "top up" the water level in the two{swimming}pools.The swimming baths are situated appropriately enough in Bath Road,which is right in the centre of Stourbridge.The swimming pool offers many Stourbridge people,both old and young,the opportunity to enjoy their leisure and{recreation}time fully.
